geneSummary: SMAD4 encodes a tumor suppressor and transcription factor that is a downstream effector in the TGF-ß signal transduction pathway. SMAD4 is frequently mutated in pancreatic and colorectal cancer and infrequently mutated in various other cancers.

mutationEffect.description: The SMAD4 E330K mutation is located in the MH2 domain, which is an interaction surface for SMAD4 binding partners. Expression of this mutation in HT-29 cell lines resulted in decreased SMAD-mediated transcription, likely leading to altered TGFß -mediated growth control (PMID: 26488212).

variantSummary: The SMAD4 E330K mutation is likely oncogenic.
